title: Can an average student do CA? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for A2A Sanchit Khandelwal I am writing an answer after a very long time after CA final results and I am really sorry for not replying to all your messages and your A2A’s as I was very much occupied studying for interviews and giving them. Sorry again. Now, the entry level to CA requires you to pass in 12th and if you are planning to pursue after graduation too, there is minimum percentage criteria for Commerce and Non-Commerce graduates who can directly enter into CA intermediate. So usually everyone is eligible for CA. I have been an average student all my life. So, I think I can help you with this. I had scored just a little above 80% in my 10th and in 12th. So, you can figure out that I definitely wasn’t a very bright student. I managed to do just okay ! Now, what you do in these 5 years post entering into CA course is of utmost importance. For an average student like me I did have to take a lot of efforts and hardwork consistently throughout these years. You will meet different kinds of people during your CA journey. Someone being talented throughout, but unable to clear, someone just average but managing to clear, someone addicted to the social media but even then being talented they aren’t able to clear. I would like to give some advice to all the CA aspirants that I learned through my mistakes made during my journey. Identify your weakness:I used a basic blackberry phone for 5 years. I know its hard to believe but I have done it. People thing that’s too much but I have my reasons. There are people I know so talented but being on social media and still passing throughout in 1st attempt and securing ranks too. Hands down, they are amazing. Back in 11th std I was an addict to facebook and whatsapp. I knew that getting out of this addiction was very important before I started with my CA journey. After a lot of guidance and counselling from my family and teachers. I achieved it. Gave up all my social media handles. In this millennial generation which is so much dominated by social media, you can say, I have been sober for 5 years now. Even now, after one month of results I still am not there on facebook or instagram. But, yes, I will soon be there too. Now, as my mom puts it, I deserve a little fun too :) 2. Optimistic Outlook: Anything that you do, always be positive about it. Trust me, it helps a lot ! Always know that the glass is half full. I have never been entirely sure after giving exams at all three levels that I will pass. Why ? Because I failed in believing myself and that I can make it through. This attitude of mine did not help me. How much ever positivity my family gave me, I could only keep worrying until the result actually came. This happens with all. Try and be positive during studies and don’t worry about the outcome. 3. Know your Priorities: Firstly to all my friends who I met just once a year, thanks for understanding and supporting in my journey. This might happen when you quit media for a long time, everyone will ask you “Ab contact kaise rakhenge” If they really are your friends and they want to be with you they will always call you or come to meet you personally. My priority was set. Becoming a CA at the age of 21. That’s it. I prioritized anything and everything that came my way. My family and studies were only on my mind ! In crux, I just want to tell you all, irrespective of being average/below or above average, Just believe in yourself, work towards your aim and rest will follow ! Regards, Mukta:) ( Applied for membership and soon the prefix will follow :) )

Certainly!  I am a CA final student And in my opinion, Average Students do it easier than people of high intelligence. Because when someone possesses high intellectual abilities, he/she is in habit of questioning everything he reads or is told. That kind of habits will irritate you all through CA journey. Because when you pay attention to what and why you're being taught something, a lot of material in CA course(not all of it, some of it is pretty good in building superb understanding about the subject) is outdated, vague, impractical in real world and a lot of suggested answers by institute to exam questions don't make sense at all.  But thats not all it, Let's say you fail in some exam(Just saying), you will naturally want to know what mistakes did you make while writing the exam. So you'll request the certified copies of your answersheet and  when you see your answer matches word to word with the answer in the institute provided material and you are still rewarded a zero. Then after a little banging your head in the wall, you further read your answersheet. Then you see they haven't even counted the marks right(even when you applied for both revaluation and certified copies for the subject, and what you're holding in your hands is supposed to be a "revalued answersheet"), you do more banging, you know why, even though its plain careless of them and ICAI doesn't give a shit even when its your life and career is on stake, you still cannot challenge them in court. Because they get you signed an agreement while you request for certified copies and revaluation that says you accept whatever marks institute awards you as final and restricts you from going to court. So in this case a person who is in habit of being good at academics being rewarded good marks for the answers he writes in the exam and thinks "right answers=good marks" will simply break down. He shall be puzzled, angry and maybe depressed also because his his basic founding assumption about the exam that exam is just a way of testing your knowledge, will simply be attacked.  On the other hand an average student who is used to getting average or less than average marks, is simply okay with failing and knows from experience that life simply is not fair and he will better understand that the best thing to do is just go on.   So CA exams and answer sheet evaluation system of ICAI is so careless, stupid, oblivious and unheeding about the amount of academic intelligence that you posess that it really doesnt matter whether you are an average or above Average student or anything of the sort. Its just like firing in the sky in night time, someone may hit the bird in the first time(plain luck), others will have to be persistent and keep trying! So of you're are clear that CA is the only way you see for reaching where ever you want to reach(be clear about the area you want to work, cause they're are many and they require different courses of action), Just go for it. How good were you at studies previously is no deciding factor and in fact, its it is out if equation when it comes to passing CA exams. Your principle( in articleship period) shall anyway throw whatever image you carry of yourself as a student out of the window :p.  So you can do it, but make sure if you're determined to do it. :)

Well, who is average, who is not, this can be decided only after the exams, right? Isn’t that the reason why we have exams in the first place? Reminds me of the lines from the famous movie ‘3 Idiots’, “Confusion hi confusion hai, solution kuch pata nahi. Solution jo mila jo saala, question ka kuch pata nahi” (There is so much confusion as we don’t know the solution yet. And when we discovered the solution, we forgot the question itself.)  In today’s world, we think so much ahead of what is required that we often tend to forget the very purpose for which we are doing things. It’s like we are all on some autopilot mode or lost in a vicious circle. The exam itself is a filter to decide who is average and who is good enough. Exams exist to allow only the apt ones to get through and pursue the benefits of those exams. Again, failing doesn’t mean you are an average person, it means you are average only in that particular field of work or knowledge. It’s been three years into student counselling for me and believe me, one of the most difficult situations that I face regularly is to explain to the students how they are wrongly choosing their career based on their marks in the past rather than their choice for the future. Decide whether you want to pursue a Career as a Chartered Accountant or not and then bring in the required efforts if you wish to be. Don’t think about marks in the past and rank yourself whether eligible or not. This is not a Government scheme where you need to be eligible. You are eligible for, the very moment you choose to. With better efforts, you can always do better in exams than your performance in the past. It is more about the field of study whether it keeps your interest and the will power to achieve it, rather than being an average or a low-grade student. I have seen many outstanding students at school level who have consistently failed in CA exams and many average students succeeding in the same. Conclusion You decide your interests and your career. Let the exams decide your mean, median and mode.

Hi every one. it's my first answer in quora. Unlike other opinions. my opinion is chance for success to average or below average person in ca course is less than 50%.to make it 70% or above you have to do lot of hard work and you nshould know your strengths and weaknesses. Coming to my details I completed CA recently.if anybody ask me whether it is easy for doing ca course for average students or for below average students. I can tell(since I am also an avg student in my school days) it's very difficult thing. Here,you have to face many challenges specially you should build confidence yourself and when you are entering into ca journey most of the people may suggest or may come to opinion that you won't complete ca. so,from starting of ca course to till completion you should have self confidence. it plays crucial role in your success.while you perusing you may face many criticisms and disappointments and corporate politics because of your struggling and some people may do fun on your strugglings. So,be prepare for all challenges and you alone should fight for your ultimate goal .no body will stay with you when your in failure side and also if you fail in one attempt you have to study with your juniors and your juniors become your batch mates and they may clear earlier than you and they may become your seniors and when years passing without success some times you may get fear that you took wrong decision by joining into ca and you may feel inside that whether to quite or continue ca course. so if you want to clear ca course be prepare your self to face these challenges……but believe me if your ready to face all these challanges and ready to give your 100% efforts towards goal you will clear Ca definitely.

Yes, an average student can surely study CA, Not only an average a below average student can also pursue CA. Tough and easy are all mind games if you can control your mind then for you my friend nothing is tough in this whole world . A good student , an average student and a below average student they all are human beings after all, the only difference between these three are the mindset they carry , their approach towards their studies. The good student always thinks of scoring good marks and he/she works for the same with a plan in their mind. An average student too thinks of scoring good marks but he/she fails to plan and finally they end up scoring average marks. A below average student always thinks about passing and sometimes they succeed but sometimes they fail too . So its our thinking that controls us if you can aim high and plan accordingly then anyone can do anything they want to. The only eligiblity for pursuing CA is that one should have passed his/her higher secondary examination. So , a good student, an average student and a bleow average student,all three are eligible for becoming a “Chartered Accountant”. The only thing that matters is our mindset and our thinking.

As being an average student i think i am a right person to comment upon this: In class 10th I had scored only 80 % and in 12th only 70% marks.After 12th exam immediately i had started for preparation of CA - CPT by self and cleared it in 1st attempt.Then i started preparing for intermediate group 1 and then I got failed in May 2018 and everyone criticized that you cleared cpt with luck and a person also said ki y 70 percent wale ca exams pass karenge. At that time I didn’t cared much about them.In NOV -18 i passed CA INTER Group 2 and in MAY-19 CA INTER Group 1.Basically you consider yourself as an average student only because you are happy with whatever you have and it’s a point of comfort zone where one seems to be direction less. We should always have a can do attitude with an appropriate plan . Personal Insight : When i first started reading Income Tax Act till 2 to 3 revision i was not even able to come to right solution to a problem but i took that subject as a challenge and targeted a exemption in it and got it in reality too . There is a idiom in Sanskrit : ‘करत -करत अभ्यास के जड़मति होत सुजान। Thanks Regards : Ansh Gupta

Is it possible for a tea maker to become Prime Minister Of India? No, statistically chances are slim. But Modi made it possible. Is it possible for a spice dealer to become Business Tycoon in India? -Again Dhirbhai Ambani made it possible. Is it possible for a amputee women to climb the Everest? -History tells us Arunima Sinha made it possible. Is it possible for a paralyzed boy to become a Yog Guru? -We have witnessed the rise of Baba Ramdev. Is it possible for a agriculturists to become a CEO of Software company? But Jyothi Reddy made it possible. So at the end we can see, if we want to conquer something big then we have to build up courage and determination. Anyone can do whatever they want to do, but finally it depends on their emotions and determination behind their goals. And once you are part of this process you no longer an average student. I hope you will earn that prefix “CA”, as early as you can! Stay glad!

CA is not for candidates who are not ready for relentless pursuit. Whether you are a topper in your school or back bencher, does not make any difference, provided you are passionate about becoming a Chartered Accountant, and are ready to relentlessly pursue the same till the Goal of becoming a Chartered Accountant is achieved. I have seen average student at a school getting All India rank in CA, and topper in the school failing in CA! The difference comes in the strength of your pursuit and good practical exposure. Kindly note that your studies for CA and your article ship are complementary. Unlike schools and colleges, where you are tested on your knowledge, a professional course like CA tests your application of mind. This is precisely where a budding Chartered Accountant with very good exposure in his article ship scores ahead. He gets trained on real time issues, which helps him to clear his CA examinations relatively easier. Similarly, his studies for CA examinations facilitates him to perform better in article ship. In this process, you will realize the synergy benefits of in depth knowledge and practical application of the same, between your CA studies and practical training under article ship.

My real life story Thinking myself Average student biggest mistake of my life. 1 I always thought that I am average and have slow understanding of concepts than my classmates. 2 This thinking landed me to biggest failure of my life. 3 My Story- #I was doing CA and I scored distinction in level-1 of CA # I passed CA - Level 2 in first Attempt # CA - Final - I passed group-2 in 4 attempts and quit CA after giving 4 attempts of group-1 4 Reason behind my quitting CA #1st Reason - was my mind was programmed from the beginning that I am Average and CA is tuf. #2nd Reason - I always used to keep option of quitting open (I.e if I am unable to clear I will quit) #After 4th attempt of Group-1 my mind started reacting, my mind won't let me study and always used to convince me to quit 5 Self Realisation - I was forced to quit by my mind due to programming done by me, otherwise I would have been able to complete my CA in next attempt. Conclusion- 1 Never bring thought in your mind that you are Average - This will really make you Average. 2 Build Confidence- Everyday write in a copy 10-times that I am intelligent. 3 Never keep option to quit open.

Hii, There is no thing such as average student. God has given equally efficient mind to all. Its our efforts which makes us average, scholar or dumb. If a so called ordinary average student put extra ordinary efforts then yes even he can crack CA. There is no big deal in Cracking CA if you are ready to give your 100 percent. I know live example of a girl who was not so good in studies. As you said she was an average student but one day she vowed that she want to crack CA. She put all the efforts she can. One and half year of hard work and burning mid night oil, she managed to achieve her dream. She Cracked all modules. After completing her article ship she finally got herself enrolled as CA. So even a average student can crack CA. Regards Dhruv Garg, Advocate

Yes definitely average students can be a CA in future. No students is average or brilliant it's matter that average students put average efforts while preparing for exams as compare to brilliant Students. CA courses do not demands from you that you must be a school or university topper. My teacher during CA course use to quote a beautiful line that”if concept is clear,CA prefix is near”, hence with little hard work and basic intelligence an average students can also clear CA course with flying colours. So friend don't hesitate to go for CA courses only because you are average students in past,dont judge your future potential with yours past few failure. So All the best for your career.

Why not ... i was a average student back then and still i am a average student and hoping soon to achieve CA prefix before my name.. I have scored 75% marks in 10th exams and 60% in 12th exams and then i chose to study CA and failed ipcc in multiple attempts .. Maybe because i never took any coaching or i was distracted whatever the case may be.. But by the God's grace i cleared my ipcc exams in May 2018 and then started coaching and all and by the mid March 2019 i completed my coaching and started preparing for my exams which is to be held in May 2019 .. ON 13TH AUGUST I CLEARED CA FINAL Group 1.. Hoping to be CA in Nov 19 exams… You can do it if you have that self believe and passion..

Absolutely Yes! CA is not a course for brilliant people it is a brilliant course for every type of student. You just need to put a great amount of effort consistently. Many people who first thought that they are everage but when they tried they cleared in 1st attempt. It is not about how hard the subjects are, it is all about how hard working and determined you are to clear it. I have seen toppers not clearing the exams. But a student who is disciplined and determined definitely cracks it. If you're thinking to crack it just go for it and put this average student thought in dustbin. Anyone can do it but with continuous efforts. All the best!!

Who have decided..you are an average student ? Is their any specific criteria ? Are all Rank holders successful ? Were all successful people toppers in their school life ? ICAI is not going to give you marks by seeing if you was a topper, mediocre, average or poor person. Your efforts in CA matters. Most (so-called) average students has created miracles even in CA field - which makes us re-think a question-Are these really average students ? Don’t under-estimate the power inside you. But beware of CA study. Even school-time toppers stuck & non-toppers pass in it.

CA is the most challenging one. Anybody, who is more ambitious, can come in and write exams. This course doesn't split a student as an average student or bright student. Those who are ambitious and those who have that eagerness to achieve this profession are the ones who come out with flying colours along with the designated letter CA. In the end, people who don't lose their hope despite the struggles during the process and work for their dreams are more successful than anyone. A CA is the strongest magnet in this world. Work for it and one day your signature will be more valued. For me and for all who loves this profession thinks, CA as a Can-do Attitude . It will pay-off soon 😁 Problems may be common but the attitude differs.

Offcourse , an average student can do CA. It is not necessary that students who are very intelligent or students who have always scored above 90% only they can do CA. Yes one has to work very hard for it no doubt but an average student can pursue CA or any other professional course. It all depends on you and how much effort you put in to clear the exams. Sometimes Intelligent people are also not able to crack professional Exams and mediocre students crack these exams. So there's nothing like an average student can't go for CA. He/she can !!

First I am interested to know what do you mean by average student. In my opinion everyone is intelligent in the areas in which he/she is interested. Maybe some are not good in studies but good in sports and vice-versa. Now answer to your question is everyone can clear CA exam if he is interested in doing so with complete dedication and proper studies. If you are not interested in commerce then you might not clear CA but that doesn't mean that you are average…may be you are good in maths, physics etc. And can clear IIT exams. So yes everyone can clear CA exams if he/she wish to.

Yes. It is tough. I don’t mean to demoralise you or something but truth be told, it is hard. I can say this because I too consider myself to be an average student. So is it impossible for average children to complete CA? No. Definitely not. You need to do honest hard work……put in the long hours, late nights. You need to attend classes before going to office and after coming back you need to revise your lessons. There is no substitute for hard work. Always remember this.There will be times when you will feel suffocated, feel over burdened, feel stressed and think of giving everything up. But always remember that it is how we tackle such trying times will help us evolve and make us stronger. All the best.

Well being average is decided by your till date study, either schooling or graduation. But CA is a passion and no one can be an average for its passion.If it is your passion and choice then go ahead, work hard and don’t think so much, but but but, if it is some kind of pressure from society, friends group or family and relatives and you cannot find yourself fit in that glass, then it is a big no. No here is not because of being an average it is because you don’t wish to do so. So identify your passion and then start it without any second thought. Best of luck.

A ranker in school , failed in some subjects or average student anyone can clear CA if he/she is willing to give up everything for studies. I have seen top rankers from school joined CA but didnt clear CA , i have also seen students with 40% in school securing AIR in CA . school marks wont determine weather you clear CA or bot its you who decide and dedicate your all efforts that will help you to clear CA. All the best

Yes, An average student can do CA. I have scored 50% in my 10th Standard from Marathi medium in 2013. After that i joined commerce (because i don't have good % to take science) and then i have scored 79% in 12th Standard. After that i joined CA and cleared CA Final in 1st Attempt in November 2019 Exam. So average students can do CA.

Its not a question of being an average student. You are not going to sit for Engineering or Rocket Science. What matters is how much sincere you are about your studies; how much effectivre time you are devoting you time for studies regularly; how smartly and methodically you are studying and above all how much practise you are making. The lasylt one is what you are producing in exam. Luck is definitely a factor but it also does help you if you dont help yourself.

Sometimes your question itself defines you . Anybody can crack any exam if he thinks he can . Firstly I want to tell you no one is intelligent , weak or average by birth the way you look at yourself your attitude towards your goal matters a lot along with your study and skills . So , first start believing yourself then start your preparation if he can do it then why not you . Yes some students are really intelligent by birth they have a tendency to catch anything in a first read but some students need some time but that doesn't mean you are average or weak you too able to do anything . So embarking on your footsteps to your goal the ball is in your court .good luck

Yes everyone can it is a course where admission is not on merits but on ones capability and hardwork… Check out Kanan Bahl profile for better ideas . As from my point of view he is one who was below average in 12 and now he has completed ipcc in first attempt which really inspires me though…and sorry kanan for tagging you without your permission…

There are no average students, there are only two kinds One with will to do itOne who does not have the will.Choose /realise which one of is you. Once you have garnered enough will , rest is just a test of perseverance. Hope it gives a perspective.

Aj Education Next believes that anyone and everyone who is interested and motivated can become a Chartered Accountant. More than intellect, the course requires dedication and practice to pass the same. At Aj Education Next, we provide students ample online and offline resources in order to prepare for the exams in best possible manner. Regular assessment and one-to-one mentoring further help students in rectifying their errors. So, what one needs is hard work, determination, and focus to add the prefix of 'CA' to their name rather than labels like 'average' or 'intelligent'.

Your chances are better than someone who has been a star at academics throughout.  Coming from first hand experience, average students put more, far more efforts. Average = Less attention and expectations from the world= Much less distraction And almost found this to be universally true for this course: Consistent Hard work >>>>>> A brilliant mind

Why do you consider yourself as average?? What are the parameters you have evaluated that you have come to the conclusion that you are an average?? There is nothing called average or brilliant student in CA, A person with right skills and his perseverance and will to be become CA desides the destiny for him/her, So stop underestimating yourself and think like a winner and focus on the target which you are aiming for…, I'm sure one day I'll see that Prefix in your name

This is hard to tell that who is intelligent and who dumb by just appearances. We are talking about CA course which is considered to be one of the hardest courses in India even worldwide. Many students take the participation and even crack it, not all of the them are genius because record shows us that top rankers didn’t do it in their first attempt. Many attempts and failures have given them lessons and strength to do so. No one is low on mind the only thing that makes difference is their hard work and determination towards the goal of their life. Many examples are available in our daily life in each field just need to open your eyes.

Firstly i clear one thing my friend that in this world nobody is average or intelligent i.e, everyone have same mind only difference is of hardwork. If you work hard then nobody can stop from clearing ca in first attempt. While doing CA one thing always kept in mind that never ignore institute material. For more guidence please subscribe my youtube channel and subscribe  If you still have any doubt then feel free to ask. If you like my answer then upvote my answer . Thank you. All The Best.

My senior scored 58% in his 12 th, while his friend secured 94 %. After qualifying CPT both joined the same coaching centre. The guy who scored less percentage completed both groups in a single go, while the other one completed the first group in his 3rd attempt and is still writing the second group. Only hard work matters in this field. The rest you learn automatically by the time you get out as a CA.

Define average for yourself. I was good at economics,accounts but bad at chemistry and physics and average at maths. I did my CA,CWA and CPA.Completed CA and CWA finals in the very first attempt,scored average of 86% in CPA managing home. It’s your hardwork,persistence,patience and passion to succeed that matters,not the standards set by someone else.

Definitely!!!!!! put faith in your self , not all the ones who crack CA are toppers keep that in mind. Do hard work , go through the syllabus and past years papers, analyse the question paper pattern and don’t slack … Every exam is easy if u put in ur hard work . Remember the difference between extraordinary and ordinary is that “Extra”. So put in all ur efforts and u will definitely clear the exam

Yes. CA studies are not rocket science but the course is tough and hectic. You need patience which can be with a below average student as well. A little pinch of luck along with hardwork and patience can do wonders for anyone. Regards, Aditya

CA Course isn't a course that is only meant for rankers or extra ordinary students , it is meant for those who can work hard and stay dedicated for a particular time frame. If you think you can stay patient and calm during setbacks this course is said to be half completed. It tests you from every aspect and it makes you prepare for the worst in life so just dont think that an average student cannot pursue and become a CA. I Hope Ive Helped You!

Yes ,an average student can have also potential to crack CA .if he /she are average student at the time of exam if they give their full attention ,full time towards their studies then not impossible for them to crack CA “Success is not always with intellectuals but also with hardworkers “.
Yes ,when that average student unites with above average ( super ) efforts and correct approach ,he can do anything
Yes...an average student can do better than..anyone else bcz there is more enthusiasm to do. .so give ur best ...
All CA requires is - RevisionContinuityExam writing skillsif a person possesses these, CA will be a breeze for them.
yes,an average student can achieve its goal by working hard,he has interest in it.so if you are a hard working student and interested in doing CA ,go for it!!

YES they can. an average student, if works hard and plans their day and study time according to a strict time table can reach the top of anything. Average students who do this can excel more than the brilliant students who don’t plan anything. YOU CAN DO IT

Hey Yes you can definitely complete tbe course with full knowledge once you understand the things instead of rattafication and can easily succeed whether you are average or brilliant. Most importantly everything demands some sacrifice to gain. So should be willing to do if you need to pass
You aren’t average, you just need to START. Shubham Agarwal's answer to Is Chartered Accountancy course too difficult for an average student? All the best!

Many of CA students are average. And many of them complete. . CA syllabus is such that even a below average can complete.Many non commerce also pass. But there is risk. If you struggle to pass and take many attempts passing CA will not be of much use. No Jobs/low salary Jobs. And the risk is 80%.
Well,an average student can become a CA but a condition is that, maths and calculations should be strong and fast Also he/she should have ability to withstand stresses related to studies,etc.

You can do CA, it is not depend on whether you are average or bright student,it depends on your potential.You can but you should have to work hard and work smart. Because every person having potential to do whatever you like
Refer to the following link: Swati Shankar's answer to Is Chartered Accountancy course too difficult for an average student?
what exact definition of avg>? in u r avg in study than dnt waste time n money, think of in which u can get up in mrng with spark in eye.. leave ca n other.. find passion , work enf hard n get there
If You are hard working then you can achieve not only .CA but everything in life. Average word doesn't matter in anyone life Thanks

It is tough for even a intelligent student if he or she doesn't study and understand the concept. If you study hard and focus on understanding concepts by making sure that baisc knowledge is gained, it becomes easy to clear. Additionally you need to make sure that you practice regularly so that you remember everything.
Yes, but need patience. Think once i.e your goal or others goal and take a decision.
Yes, all you need is dedication and focus. Best part is there is no reservation in CA course and yes it adds great value to you
No , if you are ready to study 8–12 hrs per day.
Buddy Go Through this ; Can an average student of 10th standard pass the CA exam?
What is CA?
